qas.question: Which case concerning White and Hispanic firefighters was heard by the Supreme Court in 2009?
Where was the issue of White and Hispanic firefighters heard in the case based out of?
How many whites were given the possibility of immediate promotion as a result of taking the controversial test?
What percentage of those people taking the test were African American?
What was the final vote count for the Supreme Court over the issue?
Which case concerning White and Hispanic firefighters was heard by the Supreme Court in 2019?
Where was the issue of White and Black firefighters heard in the case based out of?
How many whites were given the possibility of immediate firing as a result of taking the controversial test?
What percentage of those people taking the test were Asian American?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Ricci v. DeStefano<b5_0/><a0_0/> was heard by the United States Supreme Court in 2009. The case concerns White and Hispanic firefighters in <a1_0><b6_0>New Haven, Connecticut<b6_0/><a1_0/>, who upon passing their test for promotions to management were denied the promotions, allegedly because of a discriminatory or at least questionable test. The test gave <a2_0><b7_0>17<b7_0/><a2_0/> whites and two Hispanics the possibility of immediate promotion. Although <a3_0><b8_0>23<b8_0/><a3_0/>% of those taking the test were African American, none scored high enough to qualify. Because of the possibility the tests were biased in violation of Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, no candidates were promoted pending outcome of the controversy. In a split <a4_0>5-4<a4_0/> vote, the Supreme Court ruled that New Haven had engaged in impermissible racial discrimination against the White and Hispanic majority.
